Reviews.Title: “Helpful Workers Easily accessible site flat parking”
Reviews.Author: moonstone0005
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Lodge at the Falls in Branson, Mo. The room was clean. The hotel workers were friendly and helpful. Flat parking which is hard to find in Branson was good. Breakfast is provided by the hotel included cereals, white gravy and biscuits, coffee, hot chocolate, donuts, toast and jelly, bagels with cream cheese, muffins, hot tea, and juice. There was a swimming pool, but we did not use it. There was plenty of seating outside and inside for breakfast. The hotel is easily accessible off of 165 which takes you to the main road which is Highway 76 (The Strip).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable, and safe”
Reviews.Author: travelnmoma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in some similarly priced motels that were not nearly as nice. If you are looking for a $100+ experience, this isn't it, but as far as the moderately priced hotels go, this is a great choice. It is clean. Beds are comfortable. It's quiet and safe. The pool is nice, too. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and the location is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “One time stay-not two”
Reviews.Author: mariejackson
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Branson where The Lodge of the Falls was not our choice but was booked through a time share program. The front desk was friendly and even helped booking show tickets for us. The room furniture and tv was old but clean or so I thought. The rug had stains so I wore white socks(not white for long). The first night our bed did not have a mattress pad on it but the 2nd night we noticed the maid put one on. The refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker was nice. The safe did not work. Glad I did not have anything of value to keep safe. The breakfast was starch and more starch. Biscuits and gravy, variety of breads, frozen waffles, cake donuts, hot and cold cereals, orange juice, and coffee. Brought our own fruit to eat for breakfast. There was hot coffee in the lobby at all times-very nice. Did not use the pool as it was cool out. Did look nice though. The location was ok. There are so many more nicer hotels in Branson to pick from so I don't think I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: Pastor101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a couple of nights at the lodge at the falls hotel through Priceline.com. We arrived at the hotel at around 3am because we are very spontaneous and did leave our home until 10pm- and we live like 6 hours away. We arrived, and the door was locked, no big deal- we called the front desk at the phone outside- and Mike, the front desk manager opened the door for us to check in- he put in our information and the proceeded to collect payment. We were confused, because of two things: first, we put our credit card number online, and second, the bill was about $90 more than we were supposed to be paying. Mike said that Priceline does not charge the card- and they have to authorize payment. We showed him that we were supposed to get the room for $36 per night ( we were getting two nights) he tried getting $140 out of us, and then said that he was giving us that rate, but the extra was fees. The fees that he showed us did not make sense, and I've never had to pay these at any other hotel ever- and I've stayed at many over the years. Not only did the fees not make sense, but even those did not match up to the extra $90 he was charging us. We told him we would not pay, and we were going to cancel and stay elsewhere. Mike said this is standard, and that it's not his fault- he was pretty rude throughout all of this. We walked outside, and we're sitting in our car in the parking lot, calling Priceline, when he came out and all of a sudden the price had dropped to $117. We were expecting around a hundred because there was also a pet fee of $20 and sales tax, but even with the reduced price, we felt it was still high, and did not trust them. We finally got everything cancelled, and nothing was charged to our card, but it messed everything up- we looked for a hotel for 2 hours after leaving that would accept pets, but it's not easy finding that, or a room at 5 in the morning anyway! We ended up finding a room, but the check in time was at 3pm. We ended up sleeping in our car with our dog, for a few hours the hanging out until check in time. Ended up staying at the Dockers Inn, for one night, and it was really good. Oh, and all the extra fees Mike said was standard, this hotel did not charge- just the pet fee. AVOID lodge st falls! They will rip you off if you are not careful!

Reviews.Title: “Night desk clerk, Sue, very nice, friendly & helpful!”
Reviews.Author: DEBBIEF1970
Reviews.Content: Room was a nice size, clean and convenient with the refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, and safe. Also close enough to the strip to be able to get everywhere we needed to be within minutes but without the bumper-to-bumper traffic! For a continental breakfast I thought the selection was great. It even included hot biscuits & gravy. If I had to list a negative, I would say the bed was not as soft as what I am used to at home, but after going & doing all day in Branson, I crashed & didn't even feel the difference when sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “OK place to lay your head but great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mitchy74
Reviews.Content: If you are just looking for a clean place to lay your head at night, this is it. Decor is old, could use some updating. But it is clean and simple. Staff was very helpful, even helped when we were trying to pick a show to see, they can get tickets that are slighly discounted. This hotel is close to the action (yet just enought of a drive).. There is a Sonic very close. Very good continental breakfast - good biscuits and gravy, but other than that it was a basic continental breakfast. Small but appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Sumer88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the limited amount of time we spent in our room. It was clean, convenient to everything but not on the busy strip, and very affordable. My son loved the popcorn machine in the lobby. We weren't overly impressed by the breakfast, but that was ok because the sonic was next door. I would stay here again, especially if the price stays low.

Reviews.Title: “So So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scark
Reviews.Content: Got assigned to this hotel as part of a Vacationland package. Was not our first choice as not highly rated on here. We requested a King Room but we were given a double queen on check-in. Hotel was clean and the staff were nice and helpful. Room was just okay but had cold AC and hot water in abundance. Breakfast was pathetic. Consisted of cold biscuits and hot gravy, toast, toasted waffles, bad donuts, instant oatmeal, and cold cereal. Coffee was not good. The internet worked only the first of three nights. Think it got overloaded. Not a bad location and it was near a Sonic! Had good prices on area shows. I would not go back but have stayed in much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: northsidebassman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July and were just wanting to get away for a few days. Our daughter and grandson were with us. The staff was very knowledgeable of the area and very helpful! The breakfast was fine, though being a breakfast eater I wished they would have had Bacon and eggs! :) A few days after we arrived back home, my grandson couldn't find his pillow. I called the lodge and Debbie(I think that was her name) looked for it, found it and mailed it to us! Now that's what I call service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: firstbreath
Reviews.Content: Okay, it is possible that after reading the other reviews on TA I was expecting a bit more, but for the price one really cannot complain much. The place was quiet, plenty of parking, the rooms were a decent size, with the beds and pillows better than most economy places I have stayed. The kids loved the cookies and popcorn available in the lobby. We did have a bit of trouble when making our reservations. What happened was my husband had heard an ad on local radio saying if you mentioned the ad when you called the motel you got such and such a rate. Well, when he called the motel they didn't know anything about the ad and wouldn't give him that rate. My husband called the radio station and talked to the advertising dept., luckily he got the gal who had dealt directly with the motel on the ad, and she called the motel for him and got it straightened out. It seemed kind of silly that they wouldn't believe him as it was the same rate people have gotten through Priceline. As for their advertised breakfast, the gravy is a very bland, plain white gravy mix; however, the biscuits are very nice, but they did run low on them both mornings we were there, and we were there early. There were always plenty of the yummy donuts though. I was a little disappointed that they didn't offer hard boiled eggs, which seem to be available on a lot of complimentary breakfasts these days. Also, the breakfast staff did not seem to speak English and was rather remiss in refilling things such as coffee creamer, sweetener, and cream cheese. I noticed a few people asking for things and they were pretty much ignored. One particular incident I saw was a guy showing the lady in charge of breakfast that they were out of biscuits and instead of her letting him know there weren't anymore she just turned and walked into the room they kept the food in. He stood there for a bit thinking she was coming back with more. Would I stay there again? Possibly, but with all the deals offered on rooms in Branson it is unlikely I would seek this one out specifically.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: cde_70
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in three months and they gave me a discount. It is located pretty close to the rest of the attractions, but not on the main road (Hwy 76).

Reviews.Title: “Still not bad, but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: tippy1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago when it was Travelodge and it was a good deal. It's still a bargain but it seems a few small details are missed here and there. The air unit in our room was noisy sometimes and the lamp did not work (not the bulb, tried that). The vaccum cleaner needs to get a little closer to the walls and bed. Don't get me wrong, it's not nasty at all and I would stay here again. We did come in right behind a large tour group so the staff may have been rushed a bit. The fridge and microwave are a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: X-NJ
Reviews.Content: Real quick review of this hotel. Only stayed one night but for $49 on Priceline this place was perfect. Rooms have been painted and renovated. Mattress and linens are brand new. Bathroom was spotless. Location is great unless U want to walk to the tourist traps on 76. Pool is small but well maintained. Check in and out went well. Only thing the morning breakfast is nothing special but is U need more, walk to Sonic across the street.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracey274
Reviews.Content: if only they updated the comforters/bedding, this place would be pretty near perfection. it was clean and located in a quiet spot away from the strip. the pool was fantastic and it is always nice saving $ by eating breakfast locally. we'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: meredith3127
Reviews.Content: Booked through expedia and couldn't beat the price, especially with free breakfast, free parking, and free wifi! The guy at the front desk was really gross tho, really overweight and had nasty silver teeth! He kinda turned me off from the get go all trying to crack jokes with me, but after check in everything was great. Nice pool and we were actually the only ones in it during the day (most people got in the late afternoon/evening. Breakfast was good enough- bagels, english muffins, waffles, cereal, biscuts and gravy. Very convienent to HWY 165 and really close to Danna's BBQ, which I would highly recommend! Their BBQ nachos were awesome! We also went to Shanghai Circus right up the road, and it was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly - great place to stay at a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: HannaGrace
Reviews.Content: Newly named Lodge at the Falls, this motel just recently changed hands and the new owners are all out to please. Very friendly and helpful. All the rooms have just been renovated with all new carpet, furniture, tile in bathrooms, etc. The rooms are very clean. All rooms have a mini fridge and safe. The lobby is beautiful and as it was the beginning of Christmas season was decorated in a tasteful Christmas decor. The owners even called us the week before to confirm our reservations and, seeing that we had two rooms reserved, worked with us to get a setup that worked very well for us. We had our 3-yr-old with us and opted for a roll-away bed for her at only $5 a night. She loved it and had her own space all to herself. We go down to Branson a lot as we own a timeshare down there. Often we want to stay an extra couple of days or like to go down for the weekend so we're always looking for a hotel to stay at that we can come back to. I can tell you we are pretty picky about where we stay, especially when it comes to cleanliness and service. We WILL be coming back to stay here and are glad to recommend it to all our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great place on a budget, made to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: bkellyb
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Branson and stayed 3 nights at the Lodge at the falls, March 18-21. Rooms were always kept in good order and they went out of the way to help. Good breakfast with biscuits and gravy daily. It is located just off the yellow route and close to the Shanghai Circus, Family Fun Center, and the Fish Hatchery. We really enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Made our small children feel welcome!”
Reviews.Author: tonyic
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Branson for vacation and our stay at the Lodge of theFalls, formerly the Travelodge, was a great experience. We have two small children and the staff made them feel welcome. Their continental breakfast was a wonderful assortment of doughnuts, biscuits and gravy and cereal with orange juice. We felt very comfortable and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “1st time family vacation in Branson & will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: astnchick
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st family vacation to Branson, 1 set of grandparents included. Reserved 2 rooms, were not able to get them together due to busy time of year but they were still close. We were able to check in about 30 minutes early . Staff was friendly and helpful. We had lots of questions regarding the colored routes, etc and they were more than helpful. Rooms were clean. Pool was nice, clean, and there were plenty of chairs. Everything worked in the room, it was cleaned daily unless you requested it not to be such as my parents who are leery about having staff in their room when they aren't around. I wish the clothes hanging space was larger and that the rooms came with an iron and board. You may have to take your own even though they can provide them because you may have to wait since they get so busy. Breakfast was really good, kids loved the donuts especially. We spent a long time researching hotels and wanted something a little off the strip due to traffic and the noise and that's exactly what we got. A nice quiet hotel but yet so close to everything. The colored routes are extremely helpful in getting around. We saw other hotels we are curious about staying at but we will probably be back here again because we know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the best!”
Reviews.Author: Wisenarc
Reviews.Content: This was the first time for me and my two daughters, ages 5 and 10, and sister to go to Branson. I had heard that lodging was going to be very expensive so I was a little concerned. I did a lot of research on lodging and decided on Travelodge at the Falls as our motel. I called and talked directly to the motel and they were very helpful in setting up the reservations for me. Upon our arrival, I saw that the motel was very well taken care of. Our room was very clean and we had all that we could have asked for. The view from our room was great. I would highly recommend this motel to anyone who is going to go to Branson. Why pay higher prices when you can get all that you want and need at the Travelodge at the Falls.

Reviews.Title: “Rest easy for less”
Reviews.Author: tippy1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good bargain for what you get. We only stayed one night because of our schedule. The room we booked was a non-smoking king and our room was really clean. We've been to some higher dollar hotels in the past that were not as pleasant as this one. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is basic but good. Free 24 hour coffee in the lobby is nice. You are off the beaten path, so your not going to walk to anything but a few restaurants. If your wanting top of the line luxury, go somewhere else, but if you want a good, clean room with good service and your vacationing on a budget, this is your hotel. In the summer, you want the air conditioner to work and ours worked really good. There was also a good selection of channels on the cable TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: megn0701
Reviews.Content: Good rooms...Great price....Free internet in lobby...quiet and nice ,off the beaten path...staff was super nice and very helpful...Great free con't breakfast in the morning with waffles...Wev'e been staying here for 3 years everytime we go to branson..Can't be beat for the price and hospitality

HotelInfo.Name: Lodge at the Falls
HotelInfo.Address: 3245 Falls Pkwy, Branson, MO 65616
